Tokyo is the capital of Japan and has been the de facto seat of government since 1603 when Shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu made the city his headquarters. With a population of over 37 million people, the Greater Tokyo Area is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
London is the capital of England and the most populous city of the United Kingdom. It was founded by the Romans, and it is the world's most-visited city as measured by international arrivals.

Seoul is the capital and largest metropolis of the Republic of Korea. It was founded more than two thousand years ago in 18 BCE. Seoul is the world's 4th largest metropolitan economy with a GDP of 845 billion dollars.
